docs.snippet: Dolan, the Knicks’ owner, has decided to get into the business of raising reputations from the ashes. He has recalled Isiah Thomas from purgatory, to serve as president of the W.N.B.A.’s Liberty....
docs.lead_paragraph: Dolan, the Knicks’ owner, has decided to get into the business of raising reputations from the ashes. He has recalled Isiah Thomas from purgatory, to serve as president of the W.N.B.A.’s Liberty.
docs.abstract: Michael Powell Sports of The Times column notes that New York Knicks owner James L Dolan has hired former Knicks executive and coach Isiah Thomas as president of WNBA team New York Liberty; asserts that neither Dolan nor Thomas appears to be repentant for 2008 scandal involving wrongful firing of female executive who complained of sexual harassment by Thomas.

headline.main: James Dolan Gives an Executive Another Shot, Deserved or Not
headline.print_headline: Back at the Garden, in a Surprising Role

docs.snippet: The strange-but-true story behind Robert Van Fleet’s famous 1965 photograph from a football game between bitter high school rivals in Massachusetts....
docs.lead_paragraph: The strange-but-true story behind Robert Van Fleet’s famous 1965 photograph from a football game between bitter high school rivals in Massachusetts.
docs.abstract: Photograph taken in 1965 by Robert Van Fleet, which shows spectators watching football game between Massachusetts prep school Mount Hermon and Deerfield Academy while building burns in background, is well known but rarely fully explained; background on circumstances surrounding event are noted.

headline.main: Fire Raged, They Played On, and the Photo Still Beguiles
headline.print_headline: Fire Raged, They Played On, and the Photo Still Beguiles
